title: run: undocumented interaction between "--" and string command form

labels.name: cmd-run/rerun
labels.description: Issues about the favorite command of ReproPeople

body:
```shell
$> builtin cd /tmp/; d=/tmp/testds2; [ ! -e "$d" ] || datalad remove --nocheck "$d"; datalad create $d && cd $d && touch config file{1..3}.ext && datalad save -m 'added all' && datalad status 
[INFO   ] Creating a new annex repo at /tmp/testds2 
create(ok): /tmp/testds2 (dataset)                                                                              
add(ok): file1.ext (file)                 
add(ok): file3.ext (file)
add(ok): config (file)
add(ok): file2.ext (file)
save(ok): . (dataset)
action summary:
  add (ok: 4)
  save (ok: 1)
```
that is how it should look like if I didn't care to specify/use `{inputs}`:
```shell
$> datalad run -- parallel -j 2 echo -- *.ext
[INFO   ] == Command start (output follows) ===== 
file1.ext
file2.ext
file3.ext
```
but I wanted to be fully kosher but failed.  Here is attempts:

- in this attempt it is just a single invocation with expanded list of paths
```shell
$> datalad run --input "*.ext" -- parallel -j 2 echo -- '{inputs}'
[INFO   ] Making sure inputs are available (this may take some time) 
[INFO   ] == Command start (output follows) ===== 
file1.ext file2.ext file3.ext
[INFO   ] == Command exit (modification check follows) ===== 
action summary:
  get (notneeded: 3)
  save (notneeded: 1)
```
- 
```shell
$> datalad run --input "*.ext" -- 'parallel -j 2 echo -- {inputs}'
[INFO   ] Making sure inputs are available (this may take some time) 
[INFO   ] == Command start (output follows) ===== 
/bin/sh: 1: parallel -j 2 echo -- file1.ext file2.ext file3.ext: not found
[INFO   ] == Command exit (modification check follows) ===== 
[INFO   ] The command had a non-zero exit code. If this is expected, you can save the changes with 'datalad save -d . -r -F .git/COMMIT_EDITMSG' 
CommandError: command ''parallel -j 2 echo -- file1.ext file2.ext file3.ext'' failed with exitcode 127
Failed to run u"'parallel -j 2 echo -- file1.ext file2.ext file3.ext'" under '/tmp/testds2'. Exit code=127.
```

Is there some other way @kyleam ?
